```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(RStata)
```

```{stata first-stata, collectcode=TRUE}
sysuse auto
summarize
```

```{stata second-stata}
regress price gpm
```

```{r optional-name-code-chunk, echo=FALSE}
library(haven)
data <- stata("sysuse auto", data.out = TRUE)
data
knitr::kable(data)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see [link](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com).

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r, results='asis'}
library(magrittr)
table(mtcars$cyl) %>% knitr::kable(align = c("l","c"))
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
data <- iris
```

```{r}
stata("summarize", data.in = iris)
stata("ta Species", data.in = iris)
stata("codebook", data.in = iris)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r, echo=FALSE}
x <- 10
x
```

```{r}
x <- x + 10
x
```
